chapter.title: JBoss Maven Integration Tasks
chapter.para: This chapter will provide you with the information on how to create mavenized projects and import already existing maven project with JBoss Maven Tool.

section.title: Creating Maven ready Seam project
section.para: Maven Integration makes the Seam Wizard capable of creating Maven ready projects to let Maven get the libraries instead of using the Seam runtime.
To create a mavenized Seam project you should perform the following steps:

listitem.para: Navigate to File > New Seam Project. Give the project a meaningful name, specify a target runtime and server and select the proper configuration for your Seam project:
Click the Modify button to enable the Jboss Maven Integration facet:

figure.title: Enabling the Jboss Maven Integration Facet

listitem.para: On the JBoss M2 capabilities page you'll be prompted to add the following maven properties: groupId, artifactId, version, packaging, name and description. Here it's possible to set a Maven version of Seam and also decide whether to remove WTP classpath containers (where the path starts with org.eclipse.jst).

On the JSF Capabilities page you can choose Maven as libraries provider. This is possible when you use Maven JSF 1.2 Libraries as type of JSF Implementing Library. Also it gives you capability to edit Dependencies and Exclusions for the mavenized Seam project directly from the wizard.

figure.title: Using JSF Implementation libraries provided by Maven

listitem.para: On the Seam Facet page configure the Seam Facet settings and click Finish:

section.para: The organized Seam project contains five projects with the Maven nature, builder, Maven classpath and the pom.xml files added: projectname, projectname-ear, projectname-ejb, projectname-parent and projectname-test.

section.title: Create new mavenized Dynamic Web Project with Portlets
section.para: Select in main Eclipse menu File > New > Other. Then click Web > Dynamic Web Project. The New Dynamic Web Project wizard appears. In this wizard you should specify Project name, Target Runtime and Dynamic Web Module. More about creating Web project with Portlets you can find in JBoss Portlet Tools User Guide.
Then you should to configure Project Facets, for that you need click Modify in Configuration area. In Project Facets dialog check JBoss Core Portlet Facet and JBoss Maven Integration Facet, press OK.
On the JBoss M2 capabilities page you will be able to add the following Maven properties: groupId, artifactId, version, type of packaging, name and description.

On the JBoss Portlet Capabilities page configure Portlet Implementation Library. Select Maven Portlet 2.0 Libraries provided by JBoss Maven Integration Tool. Then you can configure Dependencies and Exclusions.
Thereafter click Finished and you will get a mavenized Dynamic Web Project with Portlets. In the same way you can create JSF and Seam Project with JBoss Portlet.

section.title: Create new JPA project with mavenized Hibernate support
section.para: To create new JPA project select in main Eclipse menu File > New > Other. Then choose JPA > JPA Project. At the first wizard page enter Project name, select Target Runtime.To add Maven Integration you need to configure Project Facets, for that click Modify button.
On the Project Facets page check JBoss Maven Integration Facet .
On the JBoss M2 capabilities page you need specify groupId, artifactId, version, type of packaging, name and description Maven properties.

On the JPA Facet page you need select Hibernate as Target Platform and Hibernate 3.3.2 Library as JPA Implementation Type. After that you can Add or Remove Dependencies and Exclusions. At the end you need to choose Database Connection and configuring its options.

figure.title: Configuring JPA Facet for mavenized Hibernate support

section.para: Click Finish and you will see mavenized JPA project with Hibernate support. Hibernate and other libraries used with JPA are managed by Maven Integration Tools and aren't included in Build Path.

figure.title: Configuring JPA Facet for mavenized Hibernate support

section.title: Create new Seam Project with Portlets using Archetypes
section.para: To create new Maven project with Seam and Portlets from archetype you should have Seam Runtime 2.2 and JBoss AS 5.1.0 Server.
If you have necessary runtimes select File > New > Project from the Navigator or Project Explorer. After that The Select a wizard dialog appears.
Select Maven > Maven Project and you will see a New Maven Project wizard. Keep defaults and click Next.
On Select an Archetype page click Add Archetype button.
In Add Archetype dialog you need specify following:
Then click OK.
On Select an Archetype page make sure that in Catalog list you select Nexus Indexer or All Catalogs option.
After that select the org.jboss.portletbridge.archetypes:seam-basic:2.0.1.BETA archetype and click Next.

note.title: Note:
note.para: If you choose Default Local in Catalog list you can get a error while creating Maven Project. To avoid this emergency you need to select Nexus Indexer Catalog.

figure.title: Select an Archetype page with added PortletBridge Archetype

section.para: On the Archetype parameters page you need complete the Group Id, Artifact Id, Version fields and enter the Package Name. Then you should click Finish.

As a result you will get the mavenized Seam project with Portlets supports. The archetype create also EAR and EJB projects. The WEB projects is project for deployment while seam-basic project is parent for the EAR, EJB and WEB projects.

figure.title: Created Maven project in Package Explorer

section.para: The created project has a configured Project Facets such as Seam, Maven Integration and JSF facets. Also Seam settings is automatically configured for the project. In generated project the Code Assist, syntax highlighting and incremental deployment are supported too.

section.title: Relevant Resources Links
section.para: You can find screencast from Snjezana Peco on http://screencast.com/t/OGMxMmFk .
General information about Maven Archetypes may be found on Introduction to Archetypes page and details about Portlets Archetypes are located on Maven Portlet Archetypes page.

section.title: Seam Projects Import
section.para: Maven Integration includes the Seam Maven configurator which is called when importing a project, changing pom.xml and/or calling Maven > Update Project Configuration. When importing a Maven Seam project, the Seam Maven configurator picks up the settings set up in pom.xml and adds to the project the following:

listitem.para: Seam facet and dependent facets to the EJB, EAR and WAR projects
JBoss Maven Integration facet if the Maven project contains a dependency with the org.jboss.seam groupId and an artifactId starting with 'jboss-seam'
other required facets (Web Module, Java, JSF, etc.)

section.para: The Maven Integration Tool will try to define Seam Runtime for the project. If it find that the version from pom.xml matches a version of a Seam Runtime, a default runtime for the Seam facet exists or there is a non-default runtime matching the Seam facet then the runtime will be set. Otherwise no any Seam runtime will be set and you need manually set it up.

The Seam configurator recognizes Seam artifacts in the following way: the view folder is a web content folder from the WAR project, the source folder is the first Eclipse source folder. If there is a folder containing "hot" in the name, it will be chosen as the action source folder. Package is the first package that has children or doesn't have any subpackage.

Configuring the Seam when importing a Maven project as well as Seam Runtime, Seam artifacts and some facets could be suspended in the JBoss Maven Integration preferences ( Window > Preferences > JBoss Tools > JBoss Maven Integration).

section.title: Portlet Projects Import
section.para: The Maven Integration Tool contains Portlet Maven configurator, which is called when you import a Maven Portlet project, call Maven > Update Project Configuration in Project Context menu or change a pom.xml file. This configurator sets up Project Facets picking up information from pom.xml in following way:

listitem.para: If the pom.xml file has a portlet-api dependency, the JBoss Core Portlet facet will be added to Project Facets.
If the pom.xml file contains portletbridge dependencies, the JBoss JSF Portlet facet appends to Project Facets.

If the project dependencies include Seam, JBoss Core Portlet and JBoss JSF Portlet facet, the JBoss Seam Portlet facet will be added to Project Facets. Also the Seam Configurator will be called to configure Seam settings.

section.para: Also you can change settings for Portlet Mavenconfigurator on JBoss Maven Integration preference page (Window > Preferences > JBoss Tools > JBoss Maven Integration ).
